cd:Time.cd:Description: Start time at start of BRC

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Number of measurements
Number of pulses
The number of measurements for which the number of corresponding valid pulses is below Meas_Cavity_Lock_Status_Thresh
The number of reference pulses with invalid status
Number of measurements with the satellite not no target status
Number of corrupt Mie measurements found to be flagged invalid or missing in the L1A product.
Number of corrupt Rayleigh measurements found to be flagged invalid or missing in the L1A product.
Number of corrupt Mie reference pulses found to be flagged invalid or missing in the L1A product.
Number of corrupt Rayleigh reference pulses found to be flagged invalid or missing in the L1A product.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Average of commanded laser frequency offset
Average laser UV energy
Standard deviation of the individual Laser frequency offset values
Laser pulse UV energy standard deviation of the N * (P-1) individual pulses, regardless of the UV_Energy_OK_Status
Mie signal to noise ratio for coadded valid pulses of the observation

Refined Mie signal to noise ratio for coadded valid pulses of the observation using the Mie Core Downhill Simplex algorithm output or Voigt fit output. If the SNR cannot be computed, or neither Downhill Simplex nor Voigt fit are selected, the field is set to -1.0.

Standard deviation of the individual Mie reference pulses refined SNR; only calculated if Voigt fit output was used to calculate the refined SNR. If Mie_Ref_Pulse_Refined_Signal_to_Noise_Ratio is set to -1.0, this field is set to -1.0 as well

cd:Integer.cd:Description: This field is a 1 byte, bit-packed field. It applies to the refined SR and/or the refined SNR calculation, whenever those values are set to -1.0. When the data is valid, Bit 1 is set to 0. Bit 1: Overall validity. Data invalid 1, otherwise 0 Bit 2: For atmospheric data this field is set to 1 if a saturated pixel was found. For the internal reference data this field is unused. Bit 3: Neither MC2 nor MC 3 selected 1, otherwise 0 Bit 4: MC3 selected but Voigt_Error_Flag not valid 1, otherwise 0 Bit 5: MC2 selected but Error_Flag not valid 1, otherwise 0 Bit 6: MC2 pre-processing not possible 1, otherwise 0 Bit 7: MC 2 post, or MC 3 processing not possible 1, otherwise 0 Bit 8: Spare

cd:Float.cd:Description: Rayleigh signal to noise ratio of channel A for the coadded valid pulses of the observation
Rayleigh signal to noise ratio of channel B for the coadded valid pulses of the observation
Col value of the energetic centroid of the mean reference pulse of the individual observation for channel A. Value set to 0 if parameter couldn’t be retrieved.
Col value of the energetic centroid of the mean reference pulse of the individual observation for channel B. Value set to 0 if parameter couldn’t be retrieved.
Energetic centroid column standard deviation for the mean reference pulse of channel A. Value set to 0 if parameter couldn’t be retrieved.
Energetic centroid column standard deviation for the mean reference pulse of channel B. Value set to 0 if parameter couldn’t be retrieved.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Number of invalid Mie bin due to invalid peak fit of the measurement data or reference pulse data
Flag indicating if the polynomial fit data of the response errors was used for the conversion of the response into a frequency

cd:Float.cd:Description: In case the Polynomial_Fit_Data_Used flag is set to 0, this field reports the corrected response of the accumulated Mie reference pulses. Otherwise parameter set to 0.0
In case the Polynomial_Fit_Data_Used flag is set to 0, this field reports the corrected response of the accumulated Rayleigh reference pulses. Otherwise parameter set to 0.0
Error quantifier for Mie
Error quantifier for Rayleigh
Error quantifier for Rayleigh channel A
Error quantifier for Rayleigh channel B
Mie wind velocity standard deviation of the individual altitude bin values
Rayleigh wind velocity standard deviation of the individual altitude bin values
Mie useful signal tandard deviation of the individual altitude bin values
Rayleigh channel A useful signal tandard deviation of the individual altitude bin values
Rayleigh channel B useful signal tandard deviation of the altitude bin
Scattering ratio of the altitude bin. If the scattering ratio cannot be computed, the field is set to -1.0 For the background radiation sample the value is always set to 0.0.
Refined scattering ratio of the altitude bin using the Mie Core Downhill Simplex algorithm output or Voigt fit output. If the scattering ratio cannot be computed, the field is set to -1.0

Standard deviation of the individual refined scattering ratio values; only calculated if Voigt fit output was used to calculate the refined SR. If the standard deviation of the SR cannot be computed or Refined_Scattering_Ratio_Mie is set to -1.0, this field is set to -1.0 as well. For the background radiation sample the value is always set to 0.0.

Refined scattering ratio of the altitude bin using the Mie Core Downhill Simplex algorithm output or Voigt fit output. If the refined scattering ratio cannot be computed, or neither Downhill Simplex nor Voigt fit are selected, the field is set to -1.0. For the background radiation sample the value is always set to 0.0.
Mie Signal-to-Noise ratio of the altitude bin. If the Mie Signal-to-Noise ratio cannot be computed, this field is set to –1.0. For the background radiation sample the value is always set to 0.0.

Refined scattering ratio of the altitude bin using the Mie Core Downhill Simplex algorithm output. or Voigt fit output. If the SNR cannot be computed, or neither Downhill Simplex nor Voigt fit are selected, the field is set to -1.0. For the background radiation sample the value is always set to 0.0.

Standard deviation of the individual refined SNR values; only calculated if Voigt fit output was used to calculate the refined SNR. If the refined SNR cannot be computed, the field is set to -1.0. If the standard deviation of the SNR cannot be computed or Refined_Mie_Signal_to_Noise_Ratio is set to -1.0, this field is set to -1.0 as well. For the background radiation sample the value is always set to 0.0.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: This field is a 1 byte, bit-packed field. It applies to the refined SR and/or the refined SNR calculation, whenever those values are set to -1.0. When the data is valid, Bit 1 is set to 0. Bit 1: Overall validity. Data invalid 1, otherwise 0 Bit 2: For atmospheric data this field is set to 1 if a saturated pixel was found. For the internal reference data this field is unused. Bit 3: Neither MC2 nor MC 3 selected 1, otherwise 0 Bit 4: MC3 selected but Voigt_Error_Flag not valid 1, otherwise 0 Bit 5: MC2 selected but Error_Flag not valid 1, otherwise 0 Bit 6: MC2 pre-processing not possible 1, otherwise 0 Bit 7: MC 2 post, or MC 3 processing not possible 1, otherwise 0 Bit 8: SR on measurement level should be processed with observation level offset, but this was not possible.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Total Mie Signal-to-Noise ratio of the altitude bin using the Mie Core Downhill Simplex algorithm output. If the signal-to-noise ratio cannot be computed, the field is set to -1.0.
Rayleigh channel A signal-to-noise ratio of the altitude bin.
Rayleigh channel B signal-to-noise ratio of the altitude bin.
Col value of the energetic centroid of the observation level altitude bin signal for channel A. Value set to 0 if parameter couldn’t be retrieved.
Col value of the energetic centroid of the observation level altitude bin signal for channel B. Value set to 0 if parameter couldn’t be retrieved.
Energetic centroid column standard deviation for the individual values for channel A. Value set to 0 if parameter couldn’t be retrieved.
Energetic centroid column standard deviation for the individual values for channel B. Value set to 0 if parameter couldn’t be retrieved.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Number of Mie invalid measurement data over all bins due to source packet invalid, data corruption, laser frequency unlocked, or satellite attitude not on target
Number of Mie invalid measurement data over all bins due to source packet invalid, data corruption, or laser frequency unlocked
Number of Rayleigh invalid measurement data over all bins due to source packet invalid, data corruption, laser frequency unlocked, or satellite attitude not on target
Number of Rayleigh invalid measurement data over all bins due to source packet invalid, data corruption, or laser frequency unlocked

cd:Float.cd:Description: Emitted responses calculated using : eqn 58 from R-2 for the reference pulse of the observation : eqn 60 from R-2 for the reference pulse of a measuremen : emitted responses are then converted to emitted frequencies
Standard deviation of the individual emitted frequencies standard deviation values

Emitted responses calculated using : eqn 58 from R-2 for the reference pulse of the observation : eqn 60 from R-2 for the reference pulse of a measuremen : emitted responses are then converted to emitted frequencies
Standard deviation of the individual emitted frequencies standard deviation values

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Flag that is set if the multimode ratio falls below the multimode ratio threshold for an observation

cd:Float.cd:Description: Mean of up to N*P values of the TXA frequency of valid pulses

cd:Record.cd:Description: RSPT temperatures for each sensor and each time sample in the BRC

cd:Float.cd:Description: Sensor RSPT temperature
Sensor RSPT temperature
Sensor RSPT temperature
Sensor RSPT temperature
Average of Aht 22 M1 temperatures
Average of Aht 23 M1 temperatures
Average of Aht 24 M1 temperatures
Average of Aht 25 M1 temperatures
Average of Aht 26 M1 temperatures
Average of Aht 27 M1 temperatures
Average of TC 18 Tel M1-1 temperatures
Average of TC 19 Tel M1-2 temperatures
Average of TC 20 Tel M1-3 temperatures
Average of TC 21 Tel M1-4 temperatures
Average of TC 25 TM15 Ths1-Y temperatures
Average of TC 27 TM16 Ths1-Y temperatures
Average of TC 29 Ths2 temperatures
Average of TC 23 Ths1 temperatures
Average of TC 32 Ths3 temperatures

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Number of Mie invalid reference pulses due to source packet invalid, data corruption, or laser frequency unlocked
Number of Rayleigh invalid reference pulses due to source packet invalid, data corruption, or laser frequency unlocked

cd:Float.cd:Description: Average laser frequency offset
Average laser UV energy
Laser frequency offset standard deviation
Laser pulse UV energy standard deviation of the (P –1) individual pulses, regardless of the UV_Energy_OK_Status.
Mie signal to noise ratio for coadded valid pulses of the measurement. If the signal to noise ratio cannot be computed, the field is set to -1.0.

Refined Mie signal to noise ratio for coadded valid pulses of the measurement. using the Mie Core Downhill Simplex algorithm output or Voigt fit output. If the SNR cannot be computed, or neither Downhill Simplex nor Voigt fit are selected, the field is set to -1.0

Standard deviation of the individual Mie reference pulses refined SNR; only calculated if Voigt fit output was used to calculate the refined SNR. If Mie_Ref_Pulse_Refined_Signal_to_Noise_Ratio is set to -1.0, this field is set to -1.0 as well.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: This field is a 1 byte, bit-packed field. It applies to the refined SR and/or the refined SNR calculation, whenever those values are set to -1.0. When the data is valid, Bit 1 is set to 0. Bit 1: Overall validity. Data invalid 1, otherwise 0 Bit 2: For atmospheric data this field is set to 1 if a saturated pixel was found. For the internal reference data this field is unused. Bit 3: Neither MC2 nor MC 3 selected 1, otherwise 0 Bit 4: MC3 selected but Voigt_Error_Flag not valid 1, otherwise 0 Bit 5: MC2 selected but Error_Flag not valid 1, otherwise 0 Bit 6: MC2 pre-processing not possible 1, otherwise 0 Bit 7: MC 2 post, or MC 3 processing not possible 1, otherwise 0 Bit 8: Spare

cd:Float.cd:Description: Rayleigh signal to noise ratio of channel A for the coadded valid pulses of the measurement. If the signal to noise ratio cannot be computed, the field is set to -1.0.
Rayleigh signal to noise ratio of channel B for the coadded valid pulses of the measurement.If the signal to noise ratio cannot be computed, the field is set to -1.0.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Invalid Mie measurement data for the current altitude bin due to source packet invalid, data corruption, laser frequency unlocked, or satellite attitude not on target, or bin below ground
Invalid Rayleigh measurement data for the current altitude bin due to source packet invalid, data corruption, laser frequency unlocked, or satellite attitude not on target, or bin below ground
Invalid mie bin due to invalid peak fit of the measurement data of reference pulse data

cd:Float.cd:Description: Scattering ratio of the altitude bin
Refined scattering ratio of the altitude bin using the Mie Core Downhill Simplex algorithm output. If the scattering ratio cannot be computed, this field is set to -1.0

Standard deviation of the individual refined scattering ratio values; only calculated if Voigt fit output was used to calculate the refined SR. If the standard deviation of the SR cannot be computed or Refined_Scattering_Ratio_Mie is set to -1.0, this field is set to -1.0 as well. For the background radiation sample the value is always set to 0.0
Error of refined scattering ratio of the altitude bin using the Voigt fit output. If the Voigt fit is not used, the field is set to 0.0.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Set to true, if the useful signal derived for the current bin is above the threshold Mie_SR_Useful_Signal_Lower_Threshold. Set to false otherwise.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Mie signal to noise ratio of the altitude bin. If the Mie Signal-to-Noise ratio cannot be computed, this field is set to -1.0
Refined Mie Signal-to-Noise ratio of the altitude bin using the Mie Core Downhill Simplex algorithm output. If the signal-to-noise ratio cannot be computed, this field is set to -1.0

Standard deviation of the individual refined SNR values; only calculated if Voigt fit output was used to calculate the refined SNR. If the refined SNR cannot be computed, the field is set to -1.0. If the standard deviation of the SNR cannot be computed or Refined_Mie_Signal_to_Noise_Ratio is set to -1.0, this field is set to -1.0 as well. For the background radiation sample the value is always set to 0.0

cd:Integer.cd:Description: This field is a 1 byte, bit-packed field. It applies to the refined SR and/or the refined SNR calculation, whenever those values are set to -1.0. When the data is valid, Bit 1 is set to 0. Bit 1: Overall validity. Data invalid 1, otherwise 0 Bit 2: For atmospheric data this field is set to 1 if a saturated pixel was found. For the internal reference data this field is unused. Bit 3: Neither MC2 nor MC 3 selected 1, otherwise 0 Bit 4: MC3 selected but Voigt_Error_Flag not valid 1, otherwise 0 Bit 5: MC2 selected but Error_Flag not valid 1, otherwise 0 Bit 6: MC2 pre-processing not possible 1, otherwise 0 Bit 7: MC 2 post, or MC 3 processing not possible 1, otherwise 0 Bit 8: SR on measurement level should be processed with observation level offset, but this was not possible.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Total Mie Signal-to-Noise ratio of the altitude bin using the Mie Core Downhill Simplex algorithm output. If the signal-to-noise ratio cannot be computed, the field is set to -1.0.
Rayleigh channel A signal to noise ratio of the altitude bin. If the Rayleigh channel A Signal-to-Noise ratio cannot be computed, this field is set to -1.0
Rayleigh channel B signal to noise ratio of the altitude bin. If the Rayleigh channel B Signal-to-Noise ratio cannot be computed, this field is set to -1.0
Velocity of attitude uncertainty error
emitted responses calculated using ...
Standard deviation for the individual eEmitted frequency values
Reference pulse FWHM

emitted responses calculated using - Equation 64 of 0 for the reference pulses of the observation - Equation 66 of 0 for the different reference pulses of a measurement. Emitted responses are then converted to emitted frequencies and averaged
Standard deviation of the individual eEmitted frequencies values

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Flag that shows the quality of the UV energy
